intro: Eriocaulon liberisepalum, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, preferring moist soil conditions. Its flowers are usually inconspicuous, with small, three-lobed bracts that enclose the tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Eriocaulon liberisepalum is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in environments with consistent moisture.
